content:
I can suggest a few films and shows that have challenged stereotypes about religion in similar ways to "higher ground" (2011):

1. "the good place" (2016-2020): this comedic television series explores the afterlife and features diverse religious and philosophical perspectives, including buddhism, christianity, and existentialism.

2. "the leftovers" (2014-2017): this television drama explores the aftermath of a global rapture event and features complex and nuanced portrayals of religious characters and communities.

3. "the story of god with morgan freeman" (2016-2019): this documentary series follows actor morgan freeman as he explores different religions and their beliefs.

4. "philomena" (2013): this drama film portrays the story of a devoutly religious woman as she searches for her long-lost son and explores themes of forgiveness and redemption.

5. "first reformed" (2017): this film follows a disillusioned pastor as he grapples with his faith and questions the role of religion in contemporary society.

these films and shows challenge traditional stereotypes and portray religious characters and communities in complex and nuanced ways, providing insights into various religious beliefs and practices.
